title: IBM Design Language
highlight: Paul Rand's 8-bar logo established grid-based design principles
details: IBM's corporate identity manual introduced systematic approaches to typography, color, and layout that influenced generations of designers.

title: NASA Graphics Standards Manual
highlight: Richard Danne and Bruce Blackburn's worm logo and modular system
details: NASA's manual demonstrated how technical constraints could inspire elegant, scalable design solutions for complex organizations.

title: British Rail Corporate Identity
highlight: Margaret Calvert and Jock Kinneir's double-arrow symbol
details: The bold, simplified identity transformed public transportation design with its clear hierarchy and distinctive typography.

title: Studio Sutherland Letterpress
highlight: Revival of traditional craft in modern contexts
details: Studio Sutherland's work shows how historical techniques can inform contemporary design, emphasizing tactility and craftsmanship.

title: Eames Institute Launch Kit
highlight: Charles and Ray Eames' educational design philosophy
details: The Eames' approach to learning through designed objects demonstrated the power of combining education, design, and play.
